comment.text: No issues with Firefox and Thunderbird flatpaks.

bugs.title: flatpak version has broken syntax highlighting preview

bugzilla.short_desc: flatpak version has broken syntax highlighting preview

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1890866
Preferences window

Description of problem:

The Flatpak version of GNOME text editor has a broken syntax highlighting preview window. See attachment for screenshot.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):

42.1 from Fedora flatpaks

How reproducible:

Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Press menu icon -> Preferences

Additional info:

Tested on Fedora Silverblue 36
The version from Flathub doesn't exhibit this issue.
FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-16dddec903 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 37 Flatpaks. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-16dddec903
FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-4705c66fa8 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 36 Flatpaks. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-4705c66fa8
adamw figured this out and it should be fixed (or at least worked around) with the flatpak runtime updates above. See https://github.com/fedora-silverblue/issue-tracker/issues/299

FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-16dddec903 has been pushed to the Fedora 37 Flatpaks testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-16dddec903

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-4705c66fa8

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-16dddec903 has been pushed to the Fedora 37 Flatpaks stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
This does look fixed on my local machine at least, we'll see in openQA once the update gets to those tests.

FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-8109f715d7 has been pushed to the Fedora 36 Flatpaks testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-8109f715d7

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-8109f715d7 has been pushed to the Fedora 36 Flatpaks stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by kalev.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'ignored'.
This update has obsoleted [flatpak-runtime-f36-3620221025180145.1](https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-FLATPAK-2022-4705c66fa8), and has inherited its bugs and notes.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
Security fixes for openssl CVE-2022-3602 and CVE-2022-3786

----

Add google-noto-sans-mono-vf-fonts to runtime

See https://github.com/fedora-silverblue/issue-tracker/issues/299

As with the recent addition of the serif fonts, this is necessary for flatpaks to show monospace fonts correctly in some cases. We believe fontconfig should manage to fall back correctly to a different font in these cases, but currently it does not, so it makes sense to add the Fedora default font to the runtime as a mitigation.
title: flatpak-runtime-f36-3620221025180145.2 flatpak-sdk-f36-3620221025180145.2
